org.openadaptor.auxil.simplerecord
Class AbstractSimpleRecordProcessor

java.lang.Object

AttributeModifyProcessor, ConditionProcessor, FilterProcessor, KeepNamedAttributesProcessor, SimpleRecordAttributeExistsProcessor
public abstract class AbstractSimpleRecordProcessor
extends Component
implements IDataProcessor

Common functionality for processors which deal with ISimpleRecords.

OA3 Core Team

process

public final java.lang.Object[] process(java.lang.Object data)
Process a single record, which must be an instance of an ISimpleRecord. Final because this is where the ISimpleRecord checking is done. If you don't want this, implement IRecordProcessor directly instead.

Specified by:
process in interface IDataProcessor
Parameters:
data - the record to be processed
Returns:
the array of records which result from processing the incoming record.
Throws:
NullRecordException - if the record is null
RecordFormatException - if the record is not an instance of ISimpleRecord
RecordException - if the processing fails

processSimpleRecord

public abstract java.lang.Object[] processSimpleRecord(ISimpleRecord simpleRecord,
                                                       boolean alreadyCloned)
                                                throws RecordException
Process a simpleRecord, nothing if it has already been cloned.

Parameters:
simpleRecord - the record to be processed
alreadyCloned - true if the record has been cloned
Returns:
Object[] containing the results of processing the incoming record
Throws:
RecordException - if processing fails

validate

public void validate(java.util.List exceptions)
Description copied from interface: IDataProcessor
This method checks that the current state of an implementation is "meaningful". Implementations of IDataProcessor are typically beans with zero-arg constructors. Implementations are encouraged to add exception to the list parameter rather than throwing them. This allows the calling code to collate the exceptions. If the implementation is an IComponent then the exceptions should be a ValidationException.

Specified by:
validate in interface IDataProcessor
Parameters:
exceptions - collection to which exceptions should be added. Must not be null

checkMandatoryProperty

protected java.lang.Exception checkMandatoryProperty(java.lang.String name,
                                                     boolean propTest)
Essentially allows you to wrap a test on a property and return an exception if it fails. For example: 

      ComponentException e = checkMandatoryProperty(foo, foo!=null);
      if ( e != null )
          throw e;

Parameters:
name - the property name
propTest - the result of a test (eg. name!=null)
Returns:
null if the test suceeded or an ComponentException if it failed

checkExactlyOneOfProperty

protected java.lang.Exception checkExactlyOneOfProperty(java.lang.String[] names,
                                                        boolean[] tests)
Loops through the list of property names supplied and if the corresponding test fails then adds the name to a list of failures and returns an exception. For example: 

      ComponentException e = checkExactlyOneOfProperty(
          new String[] {attributeName,"expression"},
          new boolean[] {attributeName!=null,expression!=null} );
      if ( e != null )
          throw e;
The exception would contain the message "Exactly one of attributeName,expression must be set" (if both failed the tests).

Parameters:
names - array of attribute names
tests - array of test (eg. attribute != null )
Returns:
ComponentException containing the names of any attributes that fail the tests or null

reset

public void reset(java.lang.Object context)
Description copied from interface: IDataProcessor
Allows calling code to communicate context information, the implementation will cast the context to an expected type.

Specified by:
reset in interface IDataProcessor
Parameters:
context -
